definition: to appear on camera/to play a role in a film

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
mirror/lens

sentences.english: What do you think about that Zhao Yazhi was nakedness for public utility?
sentences.chinese: 赵雅芝裸体出镜，晚节不保还是为公益献身？

sentences.english: They were never paid for the appearance, Jeyaraj insists.
sentences.chinese: 贾亚拉贾坚称，他们从未因这次出镜而得到报酬。

sentences.english: So where was the captain while Calypso roved?
sentences.chinese: 那么，当卡里普索出镜的同时，康斯塔船长在哪里？

sentences.english: The final version of the standup should be confirmed by the director.
sentences.chinese: 最终的出镜版本由导演确认。

sentences.english: Got a mirror first Chen time, play to impress.
sentences.chinese: 陈超得到了初次出镜时机，扮演出彩。

sentences.english: "Now, thanks to China, I have the shots I need to get jobs in America," Trepte said.
sentences.chinese: 多亏了中国，我才能有在美国出镜的机会。

sentences.english: Doing something false, just for the sake of visibility, never works.
sentences.chinese: 仅仅为了出镜率而做错事，从来都不会有好结果。

sentences.english: A film opening, Bardot nude appearance on.
sentences.chinese: 影片一开场，芭铎就裸体出镜。

definition: a face without makeup
to pose for a photo
photogenic/to appear on film or in the media
portrait/to describe sth accurately
a person's face as seen from the front
selfie
to show one's face/to make one's good name/to become successful and well known/to shine
recent photo
to take a picture or video of oneself/to take a selfie/selfie
to show oneself/to appear/(of a deity) to appear in the flesh
(fashion) model (loanword)
to film/to shoot (a picture)
photograph/picture/CL:張|张[zhang1],套[tao4],幅[fu2]
to take a joint photo/group photo
(coll.) to strike a pose
to scoop the best camera shots/to grab the limelight
